data.author: JR Mobley

changelog.release_notes:
Added optional vibration on bluetooth disconnect.
Added option to start the calendar week on Monday.
Added option to disable the World Time display.
Fixed bugs in the calendar layout.

data.description:
These unique six-segment numerals were designed in 1974 by Shuji Maezawa at Seiko.  The design doesn't seem to have ever been put into production on an actual watch.  I've chosen some typical digital watch functions of the era to create this impression of how such a watch might have been.

Features Calendar function and World Time display - a flick of the wrist will cycle between local time, a configurable world time, and UTC (Zulu time).  Display automatically reverts to local time after a short delay.

latest_release.release_notes:
Added optional vibration on bluetooth disconnect.
Added option to start the calendar week on Monday.

Fixed bugs in the calendar layout.
